name: substitute
posTip: A word that describes an action, condition or experience.

trans_examp.trans_en: to use something or someone instead of another thing or person

example.eg: You can substitute oil for butter in this recipe.
example.egtrans: 这道菜中你可以用食用油代替黄油。

example.eg: Dayton was substituted for Williams in the second half of the game.
example.egtrans: 下半场比赛戴顿换下了威廉姆斯。

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: to perform the same job as another thing or to take its place

example.eg: Gas-fired power stations will substitute for less efficient coal-fired equipment.
example.egtrans: 以煤气为燃料的发电站将会代替效率较低的燃煤装置。

name: substitute
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a thing or person that is used instead of another thing or person

example.eg: Tofu can be used as a meat substitute in vegetarian recipes.
example.egtrans: 素食菜谱中豆腐可用以替代肉类。

example.eg: Vitamins should not be used as a substitute for a healthy diet.
example.egtrans: 维生素不应用于替代健康饮食。

trans_examp.trans_en: in sports, a player who is used for part of a game instead of another player

example.eg: Johnson came on as a substitute towards the end of the game.
example.egtrans: 约翰逊在比赛接近尾声时作为替补队员上场。

example.eg: The manager brought on another substitute in the final minutes of the game.
example.egtrans: 比赛还剩下最后几分钟时，主教练又换上了一位替补队员。

phrase.phrase_title: there is no substitute for sth

dsense_body_def_block_kk.def: nothing is as good as the stated thing

example.eg: You can read about other countries, but there's no substitute for visiting them yourself.
example.egtrans: 你可以阅读有关其他国家的信息，但是什么也代替不了亲自到访体验。
